intro: Pyrostria heliconioides, commonly known as the flame tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. The plant has a smooth, greyish-bark trunk and produces large, palmate leaves that are typically 20–30 cm in diameter. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental tree due to its vibrant floral display. Pyrostria heliconioides is also valued for its ability to provide shade and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
